intro: Coluteastrum perennans, commonly known as the perennial cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Coluteastrum perennans is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along the edges of forests.
